channel.title: Fixed* By the famous Team_Rocket

item.title: Fixed* By the famous Team_Rocket
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:3, topic:427464”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=530158.msg3870421#msg3870421 date=1325303403]
You’ll need to convert this of course:

	    String blahblahblah() {
		int blahblah = Misc.random(2);
		switch (blahblah) {
			case 0: return "";
			case 1: return "";
			case 2: return "";
		}
	}

[/quote]

If there was a thank button I would thank you so I’m just gnna give you rep cuz your at 199

String randomDeath() { int death = Misc.random(2); switch (death) { case 0: return "stuff"; case 1: return "stuff"; case 2: return "stuff"; } }

Edit: Nevermind someone did it for me[/quote]

Lol you’re quite welcome. I’m more than happy to help people who can help themselves. Some kid got mad at me and de-repped me. Here’s my Skype if you need/want further help: SpecialAgentJackBower

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed* By the famous Team_Rocket
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

My random Strings

[code=java] public static String Death[] = {“You have killed”, “You proved yourself against”, “You wiped the floor with”, “No one can beat you, not even”};

public String randomDeath() {
            return Death[((int) Math.random()) * Death.length];
   }[/code]

What I am using

It is only sending the first string when I kill the person

Read full topic
